A technical masterpeice for its time, and a game that has aged well.

Not the greatest game of all time but a great game none the less.

[b]EXPLANATION OF THE GAME[/b]

Half-Life 2 (released on 2004) is the sequel to the videogame Half-Life, released on 1998. You play as Gordon Freeman, who awakes on a train right after G-Man stops talking to you. The game was basically made to admire the beautifulness of the Source engine, which can be seen on a City 17's square.

[b]BASICS OF THE GAME[/b]

It's like every other FPS (moving with WASD, shooting with MOUSE1, recharging with R) but you now can do more things with the HEV suit, like running (hold down the SHIFT key), swimming and the lantern. The lantern has been improved since Half-Life. All of those three features consume [b]auxiliar power[/b], and spends them, so use them carefully. You can pick up items with E, you pick up weapons and munition simply walking upon them.

[b]OVERALL NOTE[/b]

Graphics: 10/10
Soundtrack: 10/10
Playability: 10/10
FINAL NOTE: 10/10 (Masterpiece)

[b]THE GOOD[/b]
-The graphics are AWESOME!
-The soundtrack is very good
-Life in that game is very hard

[b]THE BAD[/b]
-A tiny bit of lag
-I have only a few bad things to tell about Half

Я лгал родителям, что иду делать домашку к другу, а нас самом деле бежал к нему, чтобы поиграть в первую часть Half Life, потому что тогда дома компьютера еще не было. Я перепроходил ее дома, когда родители купили ПК. Я не ел в школе и копил деньги на пиратский диск Half Life 2. Как вы думаете, что я сделал, когда случайно наткнулся на этот шедевр в стиме? Правильно, купил полную коллекцию. 
В этом ворохе бэттлфилдов, КоДов, биошоков вся серия Half Life до сих является для меня глотком свежего и приятного воздуха. Шикарный геймплей, отличный сюжет, графика, которая приятна глазу, не смотря на то, что игре 10 лет. Лучшая игра всех времен и народов? Серия Half life.

Half-Life 2 is a game that surprised me greatly. Even though I still think it doesn't hold a candle original, I'm glad that I decided to take the time to try it a couple of years ago. I was reluctant to try it back then but I don't really remember why anymore. 

This game is great fun, which includes the Episode 1 and Episode 2 expansions. Just another great example of the work that Valve is capable of, story, game play and graphics wise. Keep in mind that this game was released several years ago so back then the graphics were well ahead of their time and this was deemed a revolutionary game, and for good reason too.

This game really needs no introduction or further explanation,  so I just want to say that if you haven't played this or are reluctant to give it a try (like I was), you really should play it! Valve practically give this away in their sales even though it is worth far more than what they charge for it these days. A revolutionary game is revolutionary for a reason. Experience why and understand why Half-Life 3 is the most anticipated game in history.
Already waiting for HL3!
One of the best action games i have played on PC!! I strongly recommend getting this Half-Life 2 of a game.

The reason I felt I needed to write this review is my old laptop. You see, I've never had a computer that could handle the best, newest games. I've always had to wait for a few years before I could jump in on something. Half Life 2 has shocked me today. I decided to install it just to have fun watching how my laptop, running Arch Linux, struggles to do something useful for the game with its Intel 945. Granted, it took a couple minutes to load, but when it did, I was surprised to see that the main menu is giving me some steady 30 FPS. My processor, mind you, is a Core 2 Duo @ 1.5 GHz, so no big deal. I was able to play for a little while and, although the performance wasn't too good, THERE WAS A PERFORMANCE! This is on the same computer on which System Shock 2 gives me maybe 3 frames per second. Every day I learn  something new about Valve is a day I have a little more faith in humanity. You guys are awesome. <3

There are two kinds of gamers, skrubs who don't have half life 2, and super mlg 1337's who do.
10/10

A pseudo realistic sci-fi shooter which can't help but beg the question why Valve is still allowed to make video games. The second installment of this mind boglingly bad FPS franchise continues the contrived story of Morgan Freedman in his quest to pointlessly shoot people. The act of which is incredibly unenjoyable due in part to the crippling controls, and some of the most unintutive shooting mechanics to date. Speaking of which, I should take the time to mention that the weapon selection in this game ranges from pointless to an aenurysm causing level of retardation. In retrospect one could even say that Half Life 2 represent everything wrong with Modern Video games. A dry, humorless First Person shooter with unpolished gameplay, vomit enducing graphics, and a purely broken story. The story at its core truly is broken, featuring a contrived an nonsensicle chain of events, forgetable characters, a setting more generic than its predesescore, and hysterically, overwhelmingly, dumb dialouge. I would say that this game is forgetable but its awfulness leaves such an impact, that I wish I could forget it more.

Algumas verdades para quem quer jogar Half-Life 2:

- Ele está diretamente ligado ao universo de Portal.
- O jogo tem uma história complexa.
- Ainda não existe final para a história.
- O personagem é mudo.
- Você vai começar a fazer piadas com o número 3.
- Você vai morrer sem saber o final deste jogo.
